title: @badass Layer 0: Foundation Packages
description:
Initialize @badass monorepo packages with core infrastructure. Layer 0 packages have no internal dependencies and can be built in parallel.

LOCKED DECISIONS:
- Package namespace: @badass/*
- Router: Effect-TS at handler layer, type-state builder pattern (uploadthing style)
- DB: Drizzle with ContentResource + ContentResourceResource pattern
- Auth: BetterAuth with hive+spoke model, device flow for CLI/local apps
- Video: Separate VideoResource type, Mux + Inngest

REFERENCE IMPLEMENTATIONS:
- uploadthing builder: ~/.opencode-autopsy/pingdotgg/uploadthing/packages/uploadthing/src/_internal/upload-builder.ts
- course-builder core: legacy/course-builder/packages/core/
- course-builder adapter: legacy/course-builder/packages/adapter-drizzle/
- ai-hero content model: legacy/course-builder/apps/ai-hero/src/lib/

Layer 0 (parallel - no deps):
1. @badass/core - Router builder, schemas, Effect integration
2. @badass/db - Drizzle adapter, ContentResource schema

Layer 1 (depends on core + db):
3. @badass/auth - BetterAuth integration, hive+spoke, device flow
4. @badass/next - Next.js adapter for router

Layer 2 (depends on all above):
5. @badass/video - Mux integration, Inngest jobs, VideoResource

title: Testing Infrastructure + TDD Retrofit
description:
Establish testing patterns and write comprehensive test suites for @badass packages.

TESTING STACK:
- Vitest for unit/integration tests in packages (with @effect/vitest for Effect code)
- Playwright for e2e tests in apps
- expectTypeOf for type-level testing (router builder types)

PATTERNS (from testing-patterns skill):
- TDD: Red → Green → Refactor
- Characterization tests for existing code
- Test behavior, not state
- Seams for dependency injection
- Fakes over mocks

SCOPE:
1. Testing infrastructure (vitest config, shared utilities, fixtures)
2. @badass/core test suite (router builder, middleware, schemas)
3. @badass/db test suite (schema, adapter, position utilities)
4. Playwright setup for wizardshit-ai (future e2e)

REFERENCE:
- uploadthing tests: ~/.opencode-autopsy/pingdotgg/uploadthing/packages/*/test/
- @effect/vitest for Effect integration: it.effect() pattern
- expectTypeOf for type assertions

title: @badass/core test suite: router builder + middleware + schemas
@badass/db test suite: schema + adapter + position utilities
DRY test infrastructure: parameterized test suites + shared fixtures
description:
Refactor test infrastructure to use course-builder patterns:

1. **Parameterized test suites** - Extract adapter tests to runAdapterTests() function that accepts db abstraction
2. **Shared fixtures** - Create packages/db/test/fixtures.ts with test data
3. **Database helpers interface** - Type-safe contract for db implementations
4. **Shell scripts for DB lifecycle** - Docker container management for integration tests
5. **Shared vitest config** - DRY config via tooling/test-utils

Reference: course-builder packages/utils/adapter.ts:84 (runBasicTests pattern)

title: Fix test infrastructure: turbo task + workspace config
description:
Fix test running from root:

1. Add `test` task to turbo.json
2. Fix vitest.workspace.ts to exclude legacy/ and only run @badass package tests
3. Verify `bun run test` works from root

Success criteria: `bun run test` from root runs only @badass/core and @badass/db tests (161 tests total)

title: Local dev database: Docker MySQL/Postgres with easy setup
description:
Easy local database for development before PlanetScale.

Requirements:
- Docker container with MySQL (or Postgres, TBD per project)
- Simple `bun db:up` / `bun db:down` scripts
- Seed data for development
- Works with Drizzle migrations

Reference: course-builder likely has patterns for this.

title: App template: Landing page + email capture + blog scaffold
description:
Template for quickly spinning up new @badass apps without copy-paste.

Standard starting point:
- Landing page
- Email capture (with database-backed emaillist provider - no ConvertKit expense out of gate)
- Blog with posts
- Post collections support

Should work like `bunx create-badass-app my-new-site` or similar.

Reference: course-builder adapters/providers pattern, emaillist provider with database option.
